title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live on Tuesday 13 June 2017 - BBC News
summary: new jobs hope for former tobacco factory .
veggie farmer gives away beef herd .
vandals cause £ 20,000 worth of damage after break-in .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 wednesday .

documents.title: delays as airport check-in system fails
text: delays as airport check-in system fails

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: today 's local live finished have come to an end .
we 'll be back at 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: weather : feeling warm with some sunshine
text: there 'll be some clear spells tonight with scattered cloud - lows of 10c ( 50f ) with the chance of some mist patches forming .
there 'll be sunny spells and scattered cloud on wednesday .
it 'll stay dry with highs of 24c ( 75f ) .
it 's also worth noting to allergy sufferers that the forecast for pollen is expected to be high to very high .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: your videos : pot hole patch up
text: a resident of rupert road in bingham has been in touch with this video after the road was repaired yesterday
stephen perkins counts 50 patches where pot holes used to be .
he said : `` when driving over it feels just as bad as when they were holes .
it will be dangerous to cycle over . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: former brewers keeper set for big money move
text: everton are on the verge of signing sunderland goalkeeper jordan pickford for a whopping £ 30m .
the 23-year-old 's certainly come a long way since his loan spells at burton albion and alfreton town .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: missing man found safe
text: police say 50-year-old ian heath , who went missing from his home in chesterfield on thursday , has been found safe and well .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mep roger helmer to stand down
text: ukip 's roger helmer has announced he 's to stand down as mep for the east midlands at the end of july .
the former conservative was elected to the european parliament in 1999 and switched to ukip in 2012 .
helmer , who was the party 's energy spokesman , also stood for south leicestershire in last week 's general election but said his decision to step down as an mep was made before then .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: traffic : accident causing delays on the m1 south
text: traffic is really beginning to build up on the m1 south near nottingham after an accident involving a car and a lorry .
you can see the congestion here at the junction with the a52
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: war horse meets robin hood
text: the national theatre 's war horse puppet trotted along to meet robin hood earlier .
nottingham 's royal concert hall will stage the acclaimed production on tour next march .
i ca n't believe how life like it is .
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: watch : police officer takes on bucking bronco
text: it seems the police at download festival had a great weekend .
first we saw your selfies with them then we saw some of you playing football with them .
now we bring you this - courtesy of thomas jenkinson on facebook
he lasts about 10 seconds - not a bad attempt .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: high pollution levels in kibworth
text: harborough district council has told the bbc it has been carrying out air pollution monitoring along the a6 in kibworth harcourt and kibworth beauchamp .
it 's found there 's an issue with higher than average levels of nitrogen dioxide .
they are now in the process of declaring it an air quality management area - this means the authority will put together a plan to improve the air quality .
there are already a lot of these in the east midlands but they are generally just in the cities and big towns .
the council will now start consulting with residents about the plan .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : somerset chase 430 target
text: it 's looking good for nottinghamshire in their one-day cup quarter-final at somerset .
set 430 for victory , the hosts are currently on 148-3 after 18 overs .
follow the scorecard and listen to live commentary here .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bathroom spy 's victims awarded council compensation
text: six young women who were secretly filmed by a drama teacher while using his bathroom have been awarded £ 70,000 in damages from derbyshire county council .
russell singleton , who was head of drama at alfreton grange arts college for 35 years , was jailed for three years and two months in april 2013 .

the settlement follows a major high court ruling last year , in which a judge concluded those affected by non-physical abuse - such as via text message or being the subject of indecent images - should be awarded damages .
author: Aleena Naylor
BBC Radio Derby newsreader

documents.title: county ins & outs 2017
text: county ins & outs 2017

documents.title: man accused of modern slavery
text: police have charged a man from derby with modern slavery offences .
it 's after they identified a man who had allegedly been brought into the uk to work but had his wages withheld .
the 51-year-old has been charged with arranging or facilitating the travel of another person with a view to exploitation and holding a person in slavery or servitude .
he is due to appear at derby crown court on thursday .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: duffy signs new deal with notts county
text: duffy signs new deal with notts county

documents.title: travellers in leicester 'for hospital appointment '
text: i 've had an update from leicester city council regarding the travellers who have parked on land near evington leisure centre .
we understand they are here for a local hospital appointment on wednesday , and have served an order for them to be off the site by 10:00 on friday . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sexual assault reported at download
text: a woman has reported being sexually assaulted at the download festival last weekend .
she said it happened in the early hours of sunday in a grassed area at the top of car park c .
the woman spent the evening with a group of people she met in the main arena when a man offered to walk her back to her tent before assaulting her .
police are appealing to the public to try and find out who the man is - he 's described as being white with dark swept back hair , in his mid to late twenties and has a geordie accent .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: forest boss expects to see grant progress
text: nottingham forest boss mark warburton has challenged midfielder jorge grant to establish himself as a first-team regular after being handed a new three-year deal .
he told the club 's official website : `` i am looking forward to working with him and watching how he takes his chance .
`` he is a young player who has gone out on loan to develop and prove a point and he has done that .
`` he has gone out , scored goals and impressed the loan club and comes back to his parent club to take the next step in his career .
`` he wants to break into the squad , force his way into the plans . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicestershire coach questions attitude
text: leicestershire coach questions attitude

documents.title: chesterfield devolution plan dropped
text: plans for chesterfield to fall under an elected mayor for sheffield have been ditched .
chesterfield 's council - and derbyshire county council - have been at loggerheads about this for over a year .
chesterfield had wanted to become a part of the sheffield city region .
they said it would bring them an extra £ 35m of investment .
but derbyshire was about to hold a referendum on the idea - which it was confident of winning .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby, political reporter

documents.title: picture shows damage after head-on crash
text: here 's a photo of this morning 's head-on crash on leake lane in stanford on soar .
both drivers had to be cut from their vehicles after the collision and were then taken to hospital .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tennis : konta through after opponent retires
text: british number one johanna konta has reached the second round of the nottingham open after compatriot tara moore was forced to retire .
konta was 6-2 3-0 up when her opponent - and british number four - moore was forced to retire due to an injury .
the 26-year-old has now amassed 300 career singles victories and will play belgian yanina wickmayer in the second round .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'offensive ' graffiti sprayed across school grounds
text: police have issued a of a group of people - after rude graffiti was daubed across the grounds of a school in swadlincote .
derbyshire police said most of the markings were too offensive to be shown to the public .
the vandalism occurred during the night at granville sports college in burton road earlier this month .
sgt graham summers , from the force , said : this does seem to be an act of pure vandalism in a school that plays an important part in the community . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hospital to merge 'to improve the quality of care '
text: burton hospital is to merge with hospitals in derby this autumn .
a business case has been agreed by the two trusts and further discussions will take place over the summer following consultations with staff and the public .
clinicians at both hospitals says the new way of working will `` improve the quality of care '' .
our partnership will improve local services for patients as we both continue our journey towards providing outstanding care .
this includes retaining queen 's hospital in burton as a vibrant district general hospital for our local population , improving the core services we offer , including our a & e .
it also enables us to work together on providing more specialist outpatient services at our community facilities in tamworth and lichfield .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: silk mill poppies cake impresses online
text: there has been lots of praise on facebook for nine-year-old theo and his cake version of the poppies installation at derby 's silk mill .
helen shore posted : `` wow what a very talented young man .
well done . ''
ian radford wrote : `` i have shared this on my facebook , but if i had the real thing there would be no sharing . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: vandals cause £ 20,000 damage after bus depot break-in
text: vandals have caused £ 20,000 damage after breaking into a bus depot in leicester and smashing the windows of 13 buses and two vans .
it happened on sunday night at the centrebus site on the troon industrial estate .
more than 60 windows were broken in total .
police said they are looking at cctv footage to try to identify those responsible .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: jackpot winners create memorial footpath
text: a group of lottery winners have teamed up to build a new footpath at the national memorial arboretum in staffordshire .
the team , which includes retired serviceman ken wedgeworth , from swadlincote , has spent two days creating the 40ft path from the main walkway to the naval section .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lions beaten by highlanders
text: leicester tigers prop dan cole came on for the last 30 minutes of the british and irish lions match against highlanders .
the lions were narrowly beaten 23-22 in dunedin .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: farmer steps in to stop cow slaughter
text: a vegetarian farmer from ashbourne has given his herd of cows to an animal sanctuary to protect them from the slaughterhouse .
jay wilde , 59 , sent 63 cattle to a rescue centre in norfolk after realising he could n't bear to send them to be killed .
he said : `` it was very difficult to do your best to look after them and then send them to the slaughterhouse for what must be a terrifying death . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: veggie farmer gives away beef herd
text: veggie farmer gives away beef herd

documents.title: cricket : notts in cup action at somerset
text: nottinghamshire are currently playing somerset in the quarter-final of the one-day cup .
riki wessels has a half-century to help his side to 121-1 after 15 overs .
get the latest score and listen to live commentary here .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: building of aerospace engineering hub underway
text: work has begun to build a multi-million pound centre for combustion and aerothermal technology at loughborough university .
the university claims the national centre will put the town at the heart of uk aerospace engineering and technology development .
at the centre there will be a focus on developing systems that will reduce the environmental impact of aircraft .
rolls-royce will be a lead partner in the project .
the centre will also become a training ground for current and future aerospace engineers .
it 's costing more than £ 11m and is expected to open in 2019 .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pair injured in head-on crash in notts
text: two drivers had to be cut from their cars after a head-on crash in nottinghamshire this morning .
police said the vehicles collided in leake lane in stanford on soar at about 07:20 .
the road has been closed since the crash and anyone with dashcam footage has been asked to contact police .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: afternoon weather update
text: plenty of cloud around this afternoon with some sunny spells developing at times .
light winds and a very high pollen count with highs of 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: end of the road for disabilities charity
text: a charity that 's helped thousands of people with disabilities across nottinghamshire and derbyshire to live at home is to close next month .

the disabilities living centre , based in beechdale road in nottingham , has been providing impartial advice and assessments for nearly 30 years but trustees have decided to close it because of a `` lack of long-term sustainable funding '' .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: gossip : mahrez linked with italian giants
text: a major italian club is interested in signing leicester city 's riyad mahrez , according to a national newspaper .
find out which one in bbc sport 's football gossip column .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: georgian building reopens as wedding venue
text: bridgford hall is reopening after a year-long refurbishment
the grade ii listed georgian building in bridgford park has previously been used as offices by the borough council and housed the register office .
now it is a hotel and civil wedding ceremony venue .
transforming the building has cost £ 2.3m - some of that money came from the heritage lottery fund as part of its heritage enterprise programme .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : cinema and skating coming to new market place
text: if you 've been near the market in leicester recently you 'll probably have noticed all the regeneration work to create a space where the old market centre was .
it 's starting to take shape now - last weekend it was used to host a gin festival and this morning it 's been used for taichi
one eye-sore still in the area is the back of the corn exchange
the plan is to cover this with a huge screen to show films in an open-air cinema .
it 's thought this wo n't be ready for about a year yet though .
city mayor sir peter soulsby also has other plans for the space including having an outdoor ice skating rink in the winter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: derby cathedral school to open in former al-madinah building
text: a head teacher is being recruited for a secondary school due to be opened by derby cathedral next year .

the church of england school will temporarily be housed at midland house in nelson street - a building previously used by the al-madinah muslim free school - but bosses hope it will eventually move to a permanent home closer to the cathedral .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tennis : konta set for nottingham open action
text: it 's day two at the nottingham open and the tournament 's top seed is due to get her first taste of action .
british number one johanna konta will take on fellow british player tara moore in the first round .
meanwhile nottingham 's jocelyn rae is in doubles action as she teams up with laura robson to face tara moore and another nottingham player , freya christie .
author: Christian Hewgill
BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: power cut in ibstock
text: it looks like there 's another power cut in ibstock - should n't last too long though
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the lies behind england 's 'last revolution '
text: the lies behind england 's 'last revolution '
author: Greig Watson
BBC News

documents.title: missing man 'may be towing caravan '
text: police say they 're concerned for the safety of a 50-year-old man who 's gone missing from his home in derbyshire .
ian heath was last seen in chesterfield on thursday and is believed to be driving a black bmw with potentially a caravan in tow .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new mansfield mp 'did not own suit '
text: most of us own at least one suit do n't we ?
well not the newly-elected conservative mp for mansfield .
ben bradley is starting his first week at westminster but told bbc radio nottingham this morning he had to go out to buy a suit for the role because he did n't own one .
he said he was more of a `` sleeves rolled up , crack on '' sort of person .
`` my shoes have still got holes in - i need to go and sort them out , '' he added .
perhaps his notts conservative colleague ken clarke can sort him out with some hush puppies .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pavement poppies lead city visitors to weeping window
text: stencilled poppies have now been added to the pavements in derby leading people from the railway station to the weeping window installation at the silk mill .
the artwork will be on display until 23 july
author: Heidi Booth
Journalist, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: travellers in evington
text: a group of travellers moved onto a site on downing drive in the evington area of leicester last night
i 've been in touch with matt bagley at the city council 's multi agency traveller unit ( matu ) - he told me the police have been in contact with him about the caravans .
he will be going over to see the travellers this morning .
i should have an update for you later today on what course of action the matu are taking .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : latest on region 's roads
text: not looking too bad at the moment
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: schoolboy impresses judges with weeping window cake
text: the weeping window installation at derby 's silk mill has been wowing thousands of visitors over the past few days .
now a cake version of the ceramic poppy artwork has been created by nine-year-old baker theo .
the spectacular creation helped him win first prize in a bake-off competition at markeaton primary school .
and here 's the real thing
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: prison cafe opens to public
text: last month , leicester prison became the first in the uk to allow cameras in to record and broadcast a tedx event .
now the prison is to open its visiting area to the public as a community cafe .
students from the city 's de montfort university have helped transform this area of the welford road jail into a bistro
the governor phil novis told the bbc the bistro is about bringing families together in a more suitable environment .
there 's even toys for children to play with .
he thinks breaking down boundaries between prisoners and the public could stop the cycle of re-offending .
in the next few months he 's hoping they can open the bistro up to more of the general public by hosting coffee mornings for community groups .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new jobs hope for former tobacco factory
text: a major developer has bought the former imperial tobacco site in nottingham and says hundreds of new jobs could be created there .
production ended at the horizon factory in lenton last year and although imperial tobacco maintains a presence there , most of the site has been acquired by henry boot developments .
the company says it 's already in discussion with potential businesses to move in .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: new contract for forest 's grant
text: nottingham forest midfielder jorge grant has agreed a new deal that will keep him at the club until 2020 .
the 22-year-old youth academy product played six games for the reds last season and also spent time on loan at notts county .
he tweeted he was `` buzzing '' after signing the new contract .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ambulance service 'needs improvement '
text: the latest report by the care quality commission into east midlands ambulance service has been published - although things have improved since last year , there are still some significant difficulties .
its overall rating from inspectors is `` needs improvement '' .
the main problem is - when you need an emergency ambulance , what do you want ?
you want it to come fast .
but emas does n't get to the scene of enough 999 calls fast enough .
the service has said there 's a reason for this - a lot of its ambulances are tied up at hospitals with hand over delays .
it also says it does n't have the investment , money and staff to deal with an increase in demand .
i 'm pleased to say safety has gone from `` inadequate '' to `` requires improvement '' so it 's gone in the right direction .
that was very embarrassing for the ambulance service last year .
the staff are praised to the hills for the brilliant care they provide once they do arrive - they 're seen as professional , caring and dedicated .
so it is structural problems - firepower and resources .
author: Rob Sissons
East Midlands Today Reporter

documents.title: watch : tuesday 's weather outlook
text: here 's how it 's looking today .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: ambulance trust report sees improvement
text: ambulance trust report sees improvement

documents.title: join us for today 's live news coverage
text: hello leicestershire , derbyshire and nottinghamshire - gavin bevis and i will be writing the updates on today 's live page .
we 'll have all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the region .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can send an email or use facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
